de.ityx.tools.tiff.util

Class MemoryFileInputFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ityx.tools.tiff.util.MemoryFileInputFilter

  • public class MemoryFileInputFilter
extends Object
    MemoryFileInputFilter allows you to read from a byte array as if it was a byte array. It has built in support for intel vs. motorola byte order (hi to lo / lo to hi). Copyright 1997 By BancTec. GNU Public license Applys.
    Version:
    %I%, %G%
    Author:
    Liz Marks
    See Also:
    RandomAccessFile

      MemoryFileInputFilter(byte[] bytesArray, boolean isIntel)
      Creates a new byte array input filter that reads data from the specified byte array in the specified byte order.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MemoryFileInputFilter

        public MemoryFileInputFilter(byte[] bytesArray,
                     boolean isIntel)
        Creates a new byte array input filter that reads data from the specified byte array in the specified byte order.
        Parameters:
        bytesArray - the byte array to read from.
        isIntel - the byte order to use.

      • MemoryFileInputFilter

        public MemoryFileInputFilter(byte[] bytesArray)
        Creates a new byte array input filter that reads data from the specified byte array. the default byte order is motorola (ie lo to hi)
        Parameters:
        bytesArray - the byte array to read from.

    • Method Detail

      • getFilePointer

        public long getFilePointer()
        Returns the current index in the byte array.
        Returns:
        the current index.

      • isIntel

        public boolean isIntel()
        Returns the current byte order.
        Returns:
        true if intel (hi to lo), false if motorola (lo to hi).

      • setByteOrder

        public void setByteOrder(boolean isIntel)
        Set the current byte order.
        Parameters:
        isIntel - true if intel (hi to lo), false if motorola (lo to hi).

      • readBoolean

        public boolean readBoolean()
        Reads a boolean from this byte array. This method reads a single byte from the byte array. A value of 0 represents false. Any other value represents true.
        Returns:
        the boolean value read.

      • readChar

        public char readChar()
        Reads a Unicode character from this byte array. The method reads 2 bytes from this byte array in the proper byte order. If the two bytes read, in the proper byte order, are b1 and b2, where each of the two values is between 0 and 255, inclusive, then the result is equal to: 
         (char) ( (b1 << 8) | b2)
        Returns:
        the next two bytes of this byte array, interpreted as a Unicode character.

      • readUnsignedByte

        public short readUnsignedByte()
        Reads an unsigned 8-bit number from this byte array. This method reads a byte from this byte array and returns that byte.
        Returns:
        the next byte of this byte array, interpreted as an unsigned 8-bit number.

      • readByte

        public byte readByte()
        Reads a signed 8-bit value from this byte array. This method reads a byte from the byte array. If the byte read is b, where 0 <= b <= 255, then the result is: 
         (byte) (b)

      • readShort

        public short readShort()
        Reads a signed 16-bit number from this byte array. The method reads 2 bytes from this byte array in the proper byte order. If the two bytes read, in the proper byte order, are b1 and b2, where each of the two values is between 0 and 255, inclusive, then the result is equal to: 
         (short) ( (b1 << 8) | b2)
        Returns:
        the next two bytes of this byte array, interpreted as a signed 16-bit number.

      • readUnsignedShort

        public int readUnsignedShort()
        Reads an unsigned 16-bit number from this byte array. The method reads 2 bytes from this byte array in the proper byte order. If the two bytes read, in the proper byte order, are b1 and b2, where each of the two values is between 0 and 255, inclusive, then the result is equal to: 
         (b1 << 8) | b2
        Returns:
        the next two bytes of this byte array, interpreted as an unsigned 16-bit number.

      • readInt

        public long readInt()
        Reads a signed 32-bit integer from this byte array. This method reads 4 bytes from the byte array. If the bytes read, in the proper byte order, are b1, b2, b3, and b4, where 0 <= b1, b2, b3, b4 <= 255, then the result is equal to: 
         (b1 << 24) | (b2 << 16) + (b3 << 8) + b4
        Returns:
        the next four bytes of this byte array, interpreted as an int.

      • readLong

        public long readLong()
        Reads a signed 64-bit integer from this byte array. This method reads 8 bytes from the byte array. If the bytes read, in the proper byte order, are b1, b2, b3, b4, b5, b6, b7, and b8, where: 
             0 <= b1, b2, b3, b4, b5, b6, b7, b8 <=255,

        then the result is equal to: 

         ((long) b1 << 56) + ((long) b2 << 48) + ((long) b3 << 40) + ((long) b4 << 32) + ((long) b5 << 24) + ((long) b6 << 16)
         + ((long) b7 << 8) + b8
        Returns:
        the next eight bytes of this byte array, interpreted as a long.

      • readFloat

        public float readFloat()
        Reads a float from this byte array. This method reads an int value as if by the readInt method and then converts that int to a float using the intBitsToFloat method in class Float.
        Returns:
        the next four bytes of this byte array, interpreted as a float.

      • readDouble

        public double readDouble()
        Reads a double from this byte array. This method reads an long value as if by the readLong method and then converts that long to a double using the longBitsToDouble method in class Double.
        Returns:
        the next eight bytes of this byte array, interpreted as a double.

      • read

        public int read()
        Reads a byte from the byte array.
        Returns:
        the next byte of data, or -1 if the end of the file is reached.

      • read

        public int read(byte[] b)
        Reads up to b.length bytes of data from this byte array into an array of bytes.
        Parameters:
        b - the buffer into which the data is copied
        Returns:
        the total number of bytes copied into the buffer, or -1 if there is no more data because the end of this byte array has been reached.

      • read

        public int read(byte[] b,
       int off,
       int len)
        Reads up to len bytes of data from this byte array (after incrementing the current index by off) into an array of bytes.
        Parameters:
        b - the buffer into which the data is copied
        off - the start offset of the data.
        len - the maximum number of bytes copied.
        Returns:
        the total number of bytes copied into the buffer, or -1 if there is no more data because the end of this byte array has been reached.

      • readFully

        public void readFully(byte[] b)
        Reads up to b.length bytes of data from this byte array into an array of bytes.
        Parameters:
        b - the buffer into which the data is copied

      • readFully

        public void readFully(byte[] b,
             int off,
             int len)
        Reads up to len bytes of data from this byte array (after incrementing the current index by off) into an array of bytes.
        Parameters:
        b - the buffer into which the data is copied
        off - the start offset of the data.
        len - the maximum number of bytes copied.

      • readProperly

        public void readProperly(byte[] bytes,
                int typeSize,
                int len)
        Reads up to len bytes of data from this byte array into an array of bytes. If our byte array file is in motorola format or the typeSize < 2 then it just does a standard array copy for len bytes.
        Parameters:
        b - the buffer into which the data is copied
        typeSize - the size of data type (ie SHORT_SIZE, ...).
        len - the maximum number of bytes copied.

      • seek

        public void seek(long pos)
        Set the current position in the byte array.
        Parameters:
        isIntel - true if intel (hi to lo), false if motorola (lo to hi).

      • length

        public long length()
        Returns the length in the byte array.
        Returns:
        the length of the byte array.

      • close

        public void close()
        Resets the byte array to null (ie. closes it).
